channel.title: Blas on Mostly Engineering
channel.description: Recent content in Blas on Mostly Engineering

item.title: Calling BLAS from Cython
item.description: It is often useful to be able to call BLAS routines directly from Cython. Doing so avoids calling the corresponding NumPy functions (which would incur a performance penalty of running interpreted code and type and shape checking) as well as re-implementing linear algebra operations in Cython (which will likely be both incorrect and slower). Existing Cython BLAS wrappers Correspondingly, there are several ways of doing so. CythonGSL provides Cython wrappers for the GNU Scientific Library.
